intro: Suregada mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao suregada, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
